error.failed-to-initialize-app: Failed to initialize the app. Please refresh this page to retry.
system.name: Authgear
system.title: Authgear Portal
errors.validation.format: {format, select, email{Please enter an email address} phone{Please enter a phone number} uri{Please enter an URL} wechat_account_id{Wechat account ID starts with gh_} http_origin_spec{An origin is a hostname without userinfo, path, query or fragment. Optionally it can start with http: or https: to enforce a scheme, otherwise HTTP or HTTPS is allowed} x_custom_attribute_pointer{Invalid attribute name} google_tag_manager_container_id{Google Tag Manager Container ID starts with GTM-} other{Invalid format}}
errors.validation.uniqueItems: Expect unique items in the list
errors.validation.minimum: Expect number larger than or equal to {minimum}
errors.validation.maximum: Expect number smaller than or equal to {maximum}
errors.validation.minLength: Expect string with length greater than or equal to {expected, plural, one{1 character} other{# characters}}
errors.validation.maxLength: Expect string with length less than or equal to {expected, plural, one{1 character} other{# characters}}
errors.validation.noPrimaryAuthenticator: Can't save the config. At least one authenticator for type {login_id_type, select, email {email} username {username} phone {phone} other {}} is needed.
errors.validation.noSecondaryAuthenticat: Can't save the config. At least one secondary authenticator is needed.
errors.validation.blocked: {reason, select, EmailDomainBlocklist{Email} EmailDomainAllowlist{Email} UsernameReserved{Username} UsernameExcludedKeywords{Username} other {}} is not allowed
errors.password-mismatch: New password does not match with confirm password, please double check
errors.password-policy.password-reused: Password cannot be reused, please check password policies below
errors.password-policy.containing-exclud: Password contains excluded keywords, please check password policies below
errors.password-policy.unknown: Password is invalid; please check password policies
errors.resource-too-large: The {resourceType, select, favicon{favicon } app_logo{app logo } app_logo_dark{app logo } other{}}file size is too large. Please upload a JPG, PNG or GIF file smaller than {maxSize} KB.
errors.webhook.disallowed: Operation is disallowed by one of your webhook handler. Raw info: {code, react, children{{info}}}
errors.webhook.timeout: Operation is disallowed because the webhook delivery resulted in a timeout. Make sure your webhook handlers return a valid response in reasonable time.
errors.webhook.invalid-response: Operation is disallowed because one of your webhook handler returned an invalid response. See {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks/webhooks} children{the documentation}} for details.
errors.network: There is a problem with the network
errors.request-entity-too-large: The file size is too large. Please upload a file that is within the size limit.
error.client-quota-exceeded: Application quota exceeded. To add more,{ReactRouterLink, react, children{upgrade your project plan} to{{to}}}.
errors.invalid-selected-image: The selected image is invalid. Try another one.

ProjectWizardDoneScreen.title: Done
ProjectWizardDoneScreen.desc: You can always change these configuration in the portal, or configure an even more complicated authentication system.
ProjectWizardDoneScreen.completion-messa: You just setup a full feature login, signup and setting page for your next app!

ProjectWizardDoneScreen.settings.desc: After your first sign up, you will be redirected to a setting page. {br, react} {br, react} You can change where to redirect users after sign up or login, and trigger setting page from your apps.

SetUserDisabledDialog.reenable-user.desc: Do you really want to re-enable user {username}? Re-enable the user {username} so that they can login again.
SetUserDisabledDialog.cancel-removal.des: Do you really want to cancel scheduled removal on user {username}? If the removal is canceled, they will be re-enabled and can login again.

LoginIDConfigurationScreen.title: Login IDs
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.columns.order: Higher priority Login ID will be shown first. E.g. if you enable both phone and email as Login ID and phone have higher priority, it will show Phone number first in login and signup screen
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.error.calling: Require at least 1 active calling code
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.modify-: Forbid the user to add, update, or delete email after signup
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.title: Email Address
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.ignoreD: Ignore dot (.) in local part (e.g. john.doe@acme.com = johndoe@acme.com)
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.blockPl: Disallow plus (+) in local part (e.g. john+app1@gmail.com)
Some email provider use "+" as an alias for multiple email forwarding to the same address. Enable this option if you want a stricter uniqueness for users per email account.
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.domainB: Require domain allowlist disabled. {br, react} {br, react} To enable domain blocklist, you will need to input email domains that you want to block in the below text field. (e.g. example.com)
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.blockFr: Block email addresses from free email provider domains
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.email.domainA: Require domain blocklist disabled. {br, react} {br, react} To enable domain allowlist, you will need to input email domains that you want to allow in the below text field. (e.g. example.com)
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.username.modi: Forbid the user to add, update, or delete username after signup
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.username.excl: To enable exclude keywords, you will need to input the keywords that you want to block in the below text field.
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.phone.title: Phone Number
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.phone.presele: Pre-select the country calling code by the IP address of the user
LoginIDConfigurationScreen.phone.modify-: Forbid the user to add, update, or delete phone number after signup
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.title: Authenticators
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.descrip: Configure how your users can authenticate themselves (such as Password), and any MFA requirements; The order will affect when both options are available, which one will show up first.
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.seconda: Mandatory, all users required to setup 2FA
Show "Do not ask again on this device" for 2FA
AuthenticatorConfigurationScreen.recover: In the case of losing access to the Secondary Authenticators, the end-user can recover their account by using the Recovery Codes.
Allow user to retrieve or regenerate recovery code again
VerificationConfigurationScreen.title: User Verification
VerificationConfigurationScreen.descript: Configure if the email or phone number of your users could be verified and if it is required
VerificationConfigurationScreen.criteria: More info in the {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/integrate/user-profile#userinfo-endpoint} children{UserInfo endpoint}}
At least one user's email/phone is verified
VerificationConfigurationScreen.verifica: Email verification is required to complete sign up
Phone verification is required to complete sign up
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.title: Anonymous Users
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.descri: Enable or disable anonymous users. Anonymous users do not have identity. They can be promoted to normal users.
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.confli: User identity conflict when promote to normal user
AnonymousUsersConfigurationScreen.user-l: For {b, react, children{web applications}}, a new anonymous user will be created when their previous session or token becomes invalid.
Users will be logged out after Idle Timeout
Users will be logged out after Session Lifetime regardless of their activity
If this is disabled, user will be logged out after closing the browser
Users will be logged out after Idle Timeout
Users will be logged out after Lifetime regardless of their activity
Change the timeout settings in the {ReactRouterLink, react, to{{applicationsPath}} children{Applications}} page.
BiometricConfigurationScreen.title: Biometric Authentication
BiometricConfigurationScreen.description: Enable or disable biometric authentication. Enable biometric authentication allows existing user using Biometric login to login their account.
BiometricConfigurationScreen.list-enable: Show biometric logins list in setting page
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.title: Single-Sign On
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.descript: Configure and enable your users to login via SSO. Read the {ExternalLink, react, href{{HREF}} children{SSO integration guide}} if you need help
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.widget.m: Forbid the user to connect or disconnect after signup
SingleSignOnConfigurationScreen.widget.w: For mobile app only, to receive delegate call when user click on login with WeChat button.

CustomDomainListScreen.title: Custom Domains
CustomDomainListScreen.desc: You can add a custom domain so that users will login via, for example, “identity.yourdomain.com”. In this case, a session cookie of domain “yourdomain.com” is written so that your websites can share the session cookies under “*.yourdomain.com” for better customers experiences.

You have no permission to delete domain
CustomDomainListScreen.activate-domain-d: Are you sure you want to activate {domain}? Only one domain can be active.

VerifyDomainScreen.error.not-custom-erro: Requested domain is not a custom domain

SessionConfigurationWidget.title: Cookie Session Settings
SessionConfigurationWidget.description: Configure the cookie session settings for {b, react, children{{domain}}}.{br, react}If you only use token-based authentication, you can simply ignore this section.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.title: Webhooks
WebhookConfigurationScreen.description: Authgear can deliver webhook events to your server when important events such as new user signup happen.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.timeout.label: Per-handler timeout (seconds)
WebhookConfigurationScreen.blocking-even: Blocking Events allow your server to check and abort operations in different scenarios. {br, react} {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks#blocking-events} children{Learn more about blocking events}}.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.non-blocking-: Non Blocking Events allow your server to receive notification asynchronously when an event happens in Authgear. {br, react} {br, react} All events will be sent to the configured endpoint, you can filter event by the type in payload. {br, react} {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks#non-blocking-events} children{Learn more about non-blocking events}}.
WebhookConfigurationScreen.signature.des: Each webhook event request is signed with a secret key. You must validate the signature to ensure the request originates from Authgear. The signature is calculated as the hex encoded value of HMAC-SHA256 of the request body and is set as the HTTP header {code, react, children{x-authgear-body-signature}}. {br, react} {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/webhooks/webhooks#check-the-webhook-signatures} children{Learn more about validating the signature}}
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.title: Admin API
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.description: The Admin API allows your server to manage your project and users via a GraphQL endpoint.
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.keys.title: List of Admin API keys
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.graphiql.des: Inspect the GraphQL schema and build queries with {ExternalLink, react, href{{graphqlEndpoint}} children{GraphiQL}}.{br, react}On your server you should always use the Admin API endpoint and the API keys.
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.graphiql.war: Please beware this is {strong, react, children{NOT}} a sandbox environment, changes are made to {strong, react, children{REAL DATA}}.
AdminAPIConfigurationScreen.api-endpoint: Accessing the Admin API GraphQL endpoint requires your server to generate a valid JWT and include it as {code, react, children{Authorization}} HTTP header. Read {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/apis/admin-apis} children{the doc}} for more details.

SMTPConfigurationScreen.title: Custom Email Provider
SMTPConfigurationScreen.description: Optimize for email deliverability by using your own SMTP server to send Authgear Emails (such as password reset code, verification) in your own domains

SMTPConfigurationScreen.port.label: Port
SMTPConfigurationScreen.port.tooltip: Port of your SMTP server. Typical values are 25, 465, 587. Avoid using port 25 if you can, since many providers have limitations on this port.

SMTPConfigurationScreen.password.label: Password
SMTPConfigurationScreen.send-test-email-: Test your SMTP configuration by sending an email to the given address.
SMTPConfigurationScreen.sendgrid.descrip: Sign up for a SengGrid account and generate a SendGrid API Key. Check {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/customize/custom-email-provider} children{our instructions}} if you need help.
SMTPConfigurationScreen.custom.descripti: Set your SMTP provider manually. Check {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/customize/custom-email-provider} children{our instructions}} if you need help.

standard-attribute.description.picture: URL to the profile picture of the end-user

standard-attribute.description.website: URL to the end-user''s webpage or blog
standard-attribute.description.email: Primary email address of the end-user
standard-attribute.description.phone_num: Primary phone number of the end-user
standard-attribute.description.gender: End-user''s gender. This value can be male, female or other custom string.

IntegrationsConfigurationScreen.title: Integrations
IntegrationsConfigurationScreen.add-on.g: Connect your container to Authgear for conversion tracking, site analytics, retargeting, and more.
GoogleTagManagerConfigurationScreen.desc: Connect your container to Authgear for conversion tracking, site analytics, retargeting, and more. See {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/integrate/google-tag-manager} children{integration guide}} if you need help.
WizardContentLayout.skip.label: Skip and I’ll set up my project manually
CreateProjectScreen.title: {apps, plural, =0{Create your first project} other{Create a new project}}
CreateProjectScreen.create-project.label: Create Project
CreateProjectScreen.app-id.label: What is the name of your project?
CreateProjectScreen.app-id.description: This is your Authgear endpoint for your applications. Once chosen, the project cannot be renamed.
CreateProjectScreen.error.invalid-app-id: Invalid Project ID. Project ID should start and end with lowercase alphanumeric characters or numbers, and it should contain only lowercase alphanumeric characters, numbers or '-'
ProjectWizardScreen.step.title: Setting up {appID} ({currentStep}/{totalStep})
ProjectWizardScreen.step1.question: How should the users sign in to your application?
ProjectWizardScreen.step1.tooltip.oob-ot: User will sign in by receiving one-time password (OTP) via email
ProjectWizardScreen.step1.message: Sign in by phone number is supported in paid plans, you can add that later.
ProjectWizardScreen.step2.question: Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) for your app?
ProjectWizardScreen.step2.description: 2FA enhances security of your end-user greatly! According to {ExternalLink, react, href{https://security.googleblog.com/2019/05/new-research-how-effective-is-basic.html} children{research}} simply having SMS as 2FA block 100% of automated bots, 96% of bulk phishing attacks, and 76% of targeted attacks. Using on-device 2FA is even better at handling targeted attacks!
ProjectWizardScreen.step3.option.totp: TOTP Devices/Apps {Text, react, className{{className}} children{ e.g. Google Authenticator, Authy}}
GetStartedScreen.title: Getting Started 🎉
GetStartedScreen.description: Here are a few steps to get you set up for success.
GetStartedScreen.counter: {remaining, plural, =0{Done! You are ready to go.} other{# remaining}}
GetStartedScreen.help-text: Post on our {ExternalLink, react, href{https://github.com/authgear/authgear-server/discussions} children{Community forum}} or {ExternalLink, react, href{https://www.authgear.com/talk-with-us?utm_source=portal&utm_medium=link&utm_campaign=getting_started} children{contact us}} to get help and support
GetStartedScreen.dismiss-button.label: I’m done with the setup. Don’t show this page again.
GetStartedScreen.card.description.authui: The authentication experience is ready! Login and account settings page are already built for you. Sign up your first user and try the UI.
GetStartedScreen.card.description.custom: Change the theme and colors of the pre-built UI to fit your branding.
GetStartedScreen.card.description.create: Start integrating Authgear with your apps. Learn more about {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/get-started/authentication-approach} children{How Authgear works}}
GetStartedScreen.card.title.sso: Add a social or enterprise login provider
GetStartedScreen.card.description.sso: Sign in to your apps with connections like Facebook, Google, Active Directory and more. {ExternalLink, react, href{https://docs.authgear.com/strategies/how-to-setup-sso-integrations} children{See setup instructions}}
GetStartedScreen.card.description.invite: Add your team members ad admin to help with your integration.
GetStartedScreen.card.skip-button.label: Skip this
